how_it_proves: FIR is primary document establishing when and how cheating complaint was reported and establishes timeline
Bank statements prove money was transferred to accused and trace the fraudulent transaction trail
Identity proof establishes identity of complainant and links accused to fraudulent transaction
WhatsApp conversations show false promises made by accused to induce victim to part with money
Email correspondence documents written false representations and promises made by accused
Eyewitness statements corroborate cheating transaction if any third party was present
Payment app transaction records provide direct proof of money transfer to accused's account
Affidavit from victim detailing circumstances of how they were deceived
FIR establishes formal complaint of breach of trust and timestamp of reporting
Promissory note or trust receipt proves that property was specifically entrusted to accused
Bank statements show entrustment amount and trace misappropriation by accused
Affidavit from complainant explaining terms of entrustment and subsequent misappropriation
Eyewitness to the entrustment transaction corroborates that property was given to accused
Email or written correspondence documenting the trust reposed and terms of entrustment
FIR immediately after theft preserves details of stolen property and incident timing
Identity proof of complainant establishes who owned the stolen property
CCTV footage may capture the theft in progress and identify the perpetrator
Eyewitness statement from person who saw the theft or thief
Seized stolen property found with accused links accused directly to theft
Purchase invoice or bill proves victim's ownership of stolen item before theft
Medical examination report documents physical injuries caused by domestic violence
Marriage certificate proves legal marital relationship making section applicable
FIR establishes formal complaint with specific allegations of cruelty against accused
WhatsApp messages showing abusive messages threats or harassment pattern from accused
Eyewitness testimony from neighbours family members or friends who witnessed cruelty
Audio recordings of abusive incidents captures actual threats and abusive language
Video recording of abuse incidents or its aftermath showing injuries
Victim's affidavit detailing history of cruelty incidents with dates and nature
Death certificate is primary proof that victim died within 7 years of marriage
Post-mortem report establishes unnatural cause of death and nature of injuries
Marriage certificate proves marriage occurred and establishes 7-year timeframe
Eyewitness statements from family and neighbours regarding dowry demands and harassment
Medical records of prior injuries showing pattern of violence before death
WhatsApp messages showing dowry demands made by accused or their family
Audio recordings of dowry demands or harassment if preserved by victim
Death certificate establishes fact of death of victim
Post-mortem report is critical evidence establishing cause and manner of death
FIR establishes when and where murder was reported and initial facts on record
Forensic evidence such as DNA fingerprints blood links accused to crime scene and victim
Weapon or instrument used for murder establishes method and links to accused
CCTV footage of accused near crime scene at time of murder
Eyewitness testimony of persons who saw accused commit murder
Call detail records establish accused's location and communications around time of murder
FIR with specific allegations of attempt to murder documents the incident
Medical examination report documents injuries to victim and severity of attack
Weapon used in attack links accused directly to attempt to murder
Forensic evidence links accused to crime scene and victim
Eyewitness account of the attack establishes identity of attacker and nature of act
CCTV footage capturing the attack attempt if available
Social media posts screenshots capturing defamatory content with URL and timestamp
Email correspondence containing defamatory statements with full headers
Witness statements from persons who read or heard the defamatory statement
Legal notice sent to accused demanding retraction prior to filing complaint
Affidavit detailing how defamatory publication caused specific reputational and financial harm
Social media posts or publications directly proving publication of defamatory matter
Identity proof connecting accused to the defamatory publication or statement
Original title deed or property document to compare with forged version
Forensic handwriting examination report proving document is forged
Identity proof to establish who the forger is and who signed the document
Witness statement from person who was present when original document was executed
Court orders related to property establishing authentic ownership chain
Original property documents for comparison with alleged forged document
Forensic document examination proving forgery of valuable security
Encumbrance certificate showing chain of title to detect when forgery was inserted
Authentic original document proving the document used was forged
Affidavit or testimony showing accused knowingly used document knowing it to be forged
Forensic report confirming the document is indeed a forgery
Audio recording of threat if available is strongest direct evidence of intimidation
WhatsApp or SMS messages containing threatening messages with date and time
Call detail records showing calls made by accused at time threats were made
Eyewitness who heard the threat can corroborate complainant's account
Social media threats or posts targeting complainant with harmful content
FIR promptly filed preserving details of threats including exact words used
Audio recording directly proves making of threatening communication
WhatsApp/SMS messages with threatening content prove communication of threat
CDR records prove calls were made from accused's number to complainant
Court proceedings record showing statement was made on oath in judicial proceeding
Contradictory witness statements or other evidence proving the statement was false
Affidavit from complainant explaining how accused's statement was materially false
Court record proving oath was administered and statement made on record
Forensic or other scientific evidence contradicting false statement made in court
Medical examination by doctor within 24 hours is most critical evidence in rape case
Forensic DNA evidence linking accused to sexual assault
FIR filed immediately after incident is essential for prosecution
Victim identity proof and accused identity proof establishing parties
Video evidence if any capturing assault or its immediate aftermath
Eyewitness testimony if any third party witnessed the incident
Medical report documenting physical injuries from assault on woman
FIR filed at time of incident preserving details of assault
Eyewitness testimony corroborating victim's account of outrage of modesty
Video recording capturing the act if available
WhatsApp messages or texts containing sexual remarks or demands
Social media messages with sexual content from accused to victim
Audio recordings of verbal sexual harassment or demands
Colleague or bystander witness to sexual harassment incident
CDR showing repeated calls from accused to victim demonstrating pattern of contact
WhatsApp messages showing repeated unwanted contact and following
GPS location data proving accused was repeatedly near victim's residence or workplace
Social media activity showing accused monitoring or contacting victim online
Identity proof of kidnapped person and complainant establishing age and relationship
CCTV footage showing kidnapping or accused with kidnapped person
CDR showing calls made by accused and location at time of kidnapping
Eyewitness account of the abduction incident

Chemical samples for forensic analysis to identify the corrosive substance used

Medical reports of persons injured during riot
Eyewitness accounts identifying specific accused and their acts during riot

Eyewitness from first and second marriage ceremonies
Identity proof linking same person to both marriages

Affidavits from affected public members describing harm caused by nuisance
Expert opinion on nature and extent of harm caused by public nuisance

Identity of accused linking them to sale or distribution of obscene material
